front.div:
The absorption and fluorescence spectra of some arylazopyrazolone dyes have been investigated.
The emission is assigned to their hydrazone form. A very good linear correlation is obtained
between the a Hammett constants and the differences of the absorption nm^im* of the hydrazone
form and the anion* Quantum chemical calculations indicate to a charge migration upon exci-
tation.
The electron donor substituenta cause bathochromic and hypsochromic shifts in the absorption
and in the fluorescence maxima reap., while the acceptor substituents shift bathoohromically
both maxima. All compounds studied except the p-N(CHs)j derivative show an anomalously large
Stokes shift in nonpolar solvents.
